title: Enumerations - Named Constants
description: Learn how to create custom types with named constant values

content.introduction:
Enumerations (enums) allow you to define a custom type with a fixed set of named values. This makes your code more readable and helps prevent errors by restricting variables to valid values.

Instead of using magic numbers or strings, enumerations give meaningful names to related constants.

### What You'll Learn
- Declaring enumeration types
- Using enumeration values
- Enumeration ordering and comparison
- Iterating through enumerations
- Combining enumerations with other types

concepts.title: Enumeration Declaration
concepts.description: Define an enumeration type listing all possible values in parentheses: type TDay = (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, ...)

concepts.title: Ordinal Values
concepts.description: Each enumeration value has an ordinal number starting from 0. Use Ord() to get the number, Succ() for next value, Pred() for previous

concepts.title: Type Safety
concepts.description: Variables of an enumeration type can only hold values from that enumeration, preventing invalid assignments

concepts.title: Enumeration with Sets
concepts.description: Enumerations work perfectly with sets for representing collections of options or flags

exercises.title: Month Enumeration
exercises.description: Create an enumeration for months and write a program that determines the number of days in a given month.
hints: Use a case statement to handle different months
31 days: Jan, Mar, May, Jul, Aug, Oct, Dec
You can list multiple values in one case: Jan, Mar, May: days := 31

exercises.title: Card Suit
exercises.description: Create enumerations for card suits and ranks. Display a card and its color.
hints: Create two enumeration types: TSuit and TRank
Clubs and Spades are black suits
Diamonds and Hearts are red suits
Use case statements to display the card name
Display format: 'Ace of Hearts, Color: Red'

exercises.title: Order Status Tracker
exercises.description: Create an order status system that tracks progression through states: Pending, Processing, Shipped, Delivered.
hints: Use a loop to progress through all states
Use Succ() to get the next status
Use a case statement to display messages for each status
Check if status < Delivered before calling Succ()
Display appropriate messages for each stage

content.summary:
Excellent work on enumerations! You've learned:

- Defining enumeration types: `type TDay = (Mon, Tue, Wed, ...)`
- Using enumeration values as constants
- Ordinal values with `Ord()`, `Succ()`, and `Pred()`
- Comparing enumerations with <, >, =, etc.
- Using enumerations in case statements
- Combining enumerations with sets
- Type safety benefits of enumerations

Enumerations make your code more readable, maintainable, and less error-prone by giving meaningful names to related values!
